definition[0]: (1974-) a US rapper and  actress who was born in New York. She was a member of the group Junior M.A.F.I.A. before beginning her solo career. Her albums include Hard Core (1996), The Notorious K.I.M. (2000), and The Naked Truth (2005). Her most successful single was Lady Marmalade (2001) which she sang with Christina Aguilera, Pink, and MÃ½a, and which was on the soundtrack for the film Moulin Rouge (2001). Her real name is Kimberly Jones.
